lines.text: Sometimes dead is better.
The soil of a man's heart is stonier, Louis. A man grows what he can, and he tends it. 'Cause what you buy, is what you own. And what you own... always comes home to you.
The soil in a man's heart is stonier.
[Talking on the phone]
First I play with Judd, then mommy came, and I play with mommy. We play daddy, we had a awful good time! Now, I want to play with you...
What did you do?
[laughs wickedly]
What did you do!
Today is thanksgiving day for cats, but only if they came back from the dead.
God sees the truth... But waits.

[to the cat]
Fuck off, hairball!
Go on. Lay down. Play dead. Be dead!
I'm sorry Louis, I'm so sorry, but don't make it worse! Don't!
I waited too long with Gage. But with Rachel... it will work this time! Because she just died, she just died a little while ago!

[echoes and fades away]
Please! Louis! No!
No Fair! No Fair, No Fair!

[In eerie haunting moan]
I'm coming for you, Rachel... And this time, I'll get you... Gage, and I, will get you. For letting us die...
[she cackles]

[Risen from the dead]
Darling!

[at Gage's funeral; to Louis]
I knew this would happen. I told her when you were first married you'd have all the grief you can stand and more, I said. Now look at this.
[screaming]
I hope you rot in hell! Where were you when he was playing in the road? You stinkin' shit! You killer of children!
[punches Louis]
I'll bite Jud. What's the bottom of the truth?

Well sometimes, dead is better. The person you put up there ain't the person that comes back. It might look like that person, but it ain't that person, because whatever lives on the ground beyond the Pet Sematary ain't human at all.
The barrier was not meant to be crossed. The ground is sour.
It's okay, Ellie! You just had a bad dream.
It wasn't a dream, it was Paxcow! Paxcow says daddy is going to do something really bad!
Who is this Paxcow?
He's a ghost! He's a good ghost! He was sent to warn us!
Has anyone ever buried a person up there?
Christ on his throne no. Who ever would?
She knew it was an abomination.
Gage, you the one playing games?

[crying]
But he's not gods cat, he's my cat... let god get his own if he wants one... not mine... not mine.

[on the the phone]
Hi, daddy. I love you... Hi, Daddy. I love you.

[to Louis]
It's your cat now.
You've done it you stupid old man. Now you've got to undo it.

[Pulls out and opens buck knife]
Gage... I've got something for you.
Rachel, is that you? I've been waiting for you, Rachel. And now I'm going to twist your back like mine, so you'll never get out of bed again... Never get out of bed again! Never get out of bed again!
I'd hate myself but I used to think "Isn't Zelda dead yet?"
Almost there, Louis.
You keep saying that.
But this time I mean it.
Come on Doc... we've got places to go.
It's that damn road!
